page.title: 11SHEEP IN THE FOREST
page.content: In the Forest of Dean sheep wander around freely on the roads, in the woods and picnic sites and sometimes into people's gardens ! The sheep are very useful because they keep the grass down and prevent paths from getting overgrown. Sometimes sheep stray on to the road and cause accidents so please drive carefully. When you go into the forest please keep your dogs on a lead because some dogs chase sheep. This is called sheep worrying. The people that keep sheep in the forest are called ship (sheep) badgers; they are members of the Commoners' Association and they have had sheep in their families for generations. The ship badgers each have a different identification mark for their sheep which makes them sometimes appear very colourful !
